parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> 2.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Positions

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Same as [[surfaceType]], but returns texture path to ground texture as string. <br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> The texture returned is of the ground, even if there is a road at that position. To get road texture use [[getRoadInfo]] command</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[surfaceTexture]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - in format [[Position2D]] or [[Position3D]] in which case Z is ignored

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_tex = [[surfaceTexture]] [[getPos]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[surfaceType]], [[getRoadInfo]]
</value></part></template>


[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
